title: Damn! my usb flash disk has died
content:
my usb flash disk has died, thanks to cheap materials, now i need to save up my money again to buy another one this time one of good quality

does anyone know any good quality 512mb flash disks?

title: Wow:
content:
Hehehe: Mine too!

Don't buy from SanDisk; they have a really stupid warenty:
They won't do anything to help me, but say "We are sorry for the inconveniance"

Sorry, I need advice in this area too.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Damn! my usb flash disk has died
content: You could try [url=http://www.verbatim.com.au/products/productdetail.cfm?ID=95025]a Verbatim one[/url], you pay more for it but they offer a lifetime warranty so you'll never have to buy another one until 512MB becomes too small.

title: Perfect:
content:
I checked the specs, and think I'll go with that.

I'm either going to get 1GB, or 2GB (2GB is getting cheaper).

Could you hook me with a link?

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Perfect:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]You could try a Verbatim one, you pay more for it but they offer a lifetime warranty so you'll never have to buy another one until 512MB becomes too small. [hr][/quote]

thank you i will consider that

title: Re: Perfect:
content: i have heard a rumor if i re-format my existing flash disk it will work again, is this true

title: Re: Damn! my usb flash disk has died
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Don't ask us; try it. [hr][/quote]

i don't think it's that, a friend says probally something loose in the stick, i'll get a computer store to look at it

title: Reformat:
content:
When you reformat a disk; you delete everything on it, and start fresh. If you don't need your data; go right ahead.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Reformat:
content: problem fixed, i bought a new 512mb dick smith brand flash disk for $64

title: Gaa!!!
content:
YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY!!!

(This may be a wild post, but no normal words can express my joy!!!)

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

GUESS WHAT!?!

MY MEMORY STICK!!!

I FOUND A BACKUP!!!

I AM SAVED!!!

I DON't HAVE TO PAY $125 TO GET IT FIXED!!!

I am just missing a few files, but I should be able to get these really soon!!!

I can spend this money, instead, on a memory stick!!!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I AM SOOO HAPPY!!!

POFIHL!!! (Pogoing on floor in happy laughter)

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Gaa!!!
content:
"I DON't HAVE TO PAY $125 TO GET IT FIXED!!!"

You never did tell us what happened when you plugged the "fried" stick directly into your PC...

Anyway, I guess like most people, you'll be more careful with backups now that you've had a close call ;-)

title: Re: Gaa!!!
content:
Yup, it's like a second religion.

[quote]Quote:[hr]You never did tell us what happened when you plugged the "fried" stick directly into your PC...[hr][/quote]

Yes I have; It just didn't work. I actually took it to a friend of mine, who's father owns a computer repair shop. His father analyzed ny memory stick, and gave me a very low chance of data-recovery, and thus that I may be just losing my money trying to have it fixed.Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Gaa!!!
content:
Taking backups is extremely annoying. I've taken only about five during all my years of computer using.
Yeah, and regretted a lot. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Gaa!!!
content:
Yes... but if you just lose years of priceless data, backup becomes a religion!!!

[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

(Like my holykeen emote?)
Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --
